alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 8:43AM CDT until April 25 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecasted to be reached during the day today. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Tuesday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 16.3 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.3 feet on 05/03/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CDT.
